eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons

Class CommunicationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.CommunicationManager

  • public class CommunicationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a connection manager for OGWAPI's communication over P2P network. There is usually only need for a single instance of this class, even if there are several devices connecting through the OGWAPI. The instance of this class maintains a pool of connection descriptors, where each descriptor represents one separate client connection. The thread safe pool is based on a synchronised HashMap implementation. It is important that the private methods for operations over the descriptor pool descriptorPoolClear, descriptorPoolGet, descriptorPoolPut, descriptorPoolRemove) are used when extending or modifying this class instead of the direct approach to the descriptorPool's HashMap (which can cause significant race conditions). Usual modus operandi of this class is as follows: 1. establishConnection - use as many times as necessary 2. use all the methods as necessary for communication 3. terminateConnection - if there is a need to close a connection for some device. 4. terminateAllConnections - cleanup when the application shuts down. After step 4, it is safe to start a new with step 1.
    Author:
    sulfo

    • Field Detail

      • CONFIG_PARAM_SESSIONRECOVERY

        private static final java.lang.String CONFIG_PARAM_SESSIONRECOVERY
        This parameter defines how the sessions that went down should be recovered. A session is a connection created when individual object logs in and the OGWAPI tries as much as possible to keep it open. However there are cases when the OGWAPI will give up its attempts to maintain the session, e.g. when the communication with server is interrupted for prolonged time (depends on engine in use). In such cases there usually is a need to recover the sessions after communication is restored. 'Aggressiveness' of OGWAPI required to recover lost sessions is scenario dependent. Following are accepted values for this parameter, along with explanations: proactive After you log your objects in and a session will go down for some reason, OGWAPI will be trying hard to reconnect every 30 seconds until it succeeds or until you log your objects out. It does not care if your object is ready to listen to incoming requests or not. Incoming requests may therefore still time out if your adapter is not ready, although it will look online in the infrastructure. Good for objects that are expected to be always online and will likely be ready to respond, e.g. VAS or other services. NOTE OF CAUTION: When you are testing (or better said debugging...) your scenarios on two machines with identical credentials, the machine that runs OGWAPI with this parameter set to 'proactive' will keep stealing your connection. If both of them are configured to do so, it will produce plenty of exceptions. none The OGWAPI will not make any extra effort to recover the sessions. If you log your object in and the session for some reason fails, it will remain so until you explicitly re-log your object. This was the original behaviour in previous versions of OGWAPI. passive This will make OGWAPI terminate (!) sessions that are not refreshed periodically. Refreshing a connection means calling the login method at least every 30 seconds by default, although this number can be altered with sessionExpiration parameter. Call to login method is optimised, so there is no overhead and it will not attempt to actually log an object in if it already is. Good for integrators that like to have things under control, implement adapters on small end user devices or have a need to implement a kind of presence into their application.
        See Also:

      • CONFIG_PARAM_SESSIONEXPIRATION

        private static final java.lang.String CONFIG_PARAM_SESSIONEXPIRATION
        When sessionRecovery is set to passive, use this to set the interval after which a connection without refreshing will be terminated. Note that this can't be smaller number than 5 seconds.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getConnectionList

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getConnectionList()
        Retrieves the object IDs that has open connections to network via this CommunicationManager. Based on these strings, the respective connections can be retrieved from the connection descriptor pool.
        Returns:
        Set of object IDs.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(java.lang.String objectId)
        Checks whether the connection descriptor instance exists for given object ID and whether or not it is connected to the network. Returns true or false accordingly.
        Parameters:
        objectId - Object ID in question.
        Returns:
        True if descriptor exists and the connection is established.

      • verifyPassword

        public boolean verifyPassword(java.lang.String objectId,
                              java.lang.String password)
        Verifies the credentials of an object, when (for example) trying to reach its connection descriptor instance via RESTLET API Authenticator. This method should be called after isConnected is used for making sure, that the object is actually connected. It is safe to use this method when processing authentication of every request, even in quick succession.
        Parameters:
        objectId - Object ID in question.
        password - The password that is to be verified.
        Returns:
        True, if the password is valid.

      • terminateAllConnections

        public void terminateAllConnections()
        Closes all open connections to network. It will also clear these connection handlers off the connection descriptor pool table, (they have to be reconfigured to be opened again, thus this should be done only when the application is about to be closed).

      • establishConnection

        public StatusMessage establishConnection(java.lang.String objectId,
                                         java.lang.String password)
        Establishes a single connection for given object with preferences from configuration file and provided credentials. The connection descriptor is then stored in the internal descriptor pool. If the connection descriptor for given object already exists, it get terminated, discarded and then recreated.
        Parameters:
        objectId - Object ID.
        password - Password.
        Returns:
        StatusMessage, with the error flag set as false, if the login was successful. If not, the error flag is set to true.

      • terminateConnection

        public void terminateConnection(java.lang.String objectId,
                                boolean destroyConnectionDescriptor)
        Disconnects a single connection identified by the connection object ID given as the first parameter. The second parameter specifies, whether the connection descriptor is to be destroyed after it is disconnected. If not, the descriptor will remain in the pool and it is possible to use it during eventual reconnection. Otherwise connection will have to be build a new (which can be useful when the connection needs to be reconfigured).
        Parameters:
        objectId - User name used to establish the connection.
        destroyConnectionDescriptor - Whether the connection descriptor should also be destroyed or not.

      • getPropertyOfRemoteObject

        public StatusMessage getPropertyOfRemoteObject(java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                               java.lang.String destinationOid,

        propertyId - ID of the property.
        parameters - Any parameters to be sent with the request (if needed).
        body - Body to be sent (if needed).
        Returns:

      • updateTaskStatus

        public StatusMessage updateTaskStatus(java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                      java.lang.String actionId,

                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)

        Parameters:
        sourceOid - ID of the source object.
        actionId - ID of the action that is being worked on right now (this is NOT a task ID).
        newStatus - New status of the job.
        returnValue - New value to be returned to the object that ordered the job.
        parameters - Parameters that goes with the return value.
        Returns:
        Status message.

      • getRosterEntriesForObject

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getRosterEntriesForObject(java.lang.String objectId)
        Retrieves a collection of roster entries for object ID (i.e. its contact list). If there is no connection established for the given object ID, returns empty Set.
        Parameters:
        objectId - Object ID the roster is to be retrieved for.
        Returns:
        Set of roster entries. If no connection is established for the object ID, the collection is empty (not null).

      • activateEventChannel

        public StatusMessage activateEventChannel(java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                          java.lang.String eventId,
                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                          java.lang.String body)
        Activates the event channel identified by the event ID. From the moment of activation, other devices in the network will be able to subscribe to it and will receive events in case they are generated. If the event channel was never activated before (or there is other reason why it was not saved previously), it gets created anew. In that case, the list of subscribers is empty.
        Parameters:
        sourceOid - Object ID of the event channel owner.
        eventId - Event ID.
        Returns:
        StatusMessage with error flag set to false, if the event channel was activated successfully.

      • sendEventToSubscribedObjects

        public StatusMessage sendEventToSubscribedObjects(java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                                  java.lang.String eventId,
                                                  java.lang.String body,
                                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Distributes an event to subscribers. The source object must be logged in first.
        Parameters:
        sourceOid - ID of the source object.
        eventId - Event ID.
        body - Body of the event.
        parameters - Any parameters to be transported with the event body.
        Returns:
        Status message.

      • deactivateEventChannel

        public StatusMessage deactivateEventChannel(java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                            java.lang.String eventId,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                            java.lang.String body)
        De-activates the event channel identified by the event ID. From the moment of de-activation, other devices in the network will not be able to subscribe to it. Also no events are sent in case they are generated. The channel will still exist though along with the list of subscribers. If it gets re-activated, the list of subscribers will be the same as in the moment of de-activation. The source object must be logged in first.
        Parameters:
        sourceOid - ID of the source object.
        objectId - Object ID of the event channel owner
        eventID - Event ID.
        Returns:
        StatusMessage with error flag set to false, if the event channel was activated successfully.

      • getEventChannelStatus

        public StatusMessage getEventChannelStatus(java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                           java.lang.String destinationOid,
                                           java.lang.String eventId,
                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                           java.lang.String body)
        Retrieves the status of local or remote event channel. The source object must be logged in first.
        Parameters:
        sourceOid - ID of the source object.
        destinationOid - ID of the object that is to be polled (it can be the local owner verifying the state of its channel.
        eventId - ID of the event.
        parameters - Any parameters to be sent (usually none).
        body - Any body to be sent (usually none).
        Returns:
        Status message.

        eventId - Event ID.
        parameters - Any parameters to be sent (usually none).

        Status message.

      • performSparqlSearch

        public java.lang.String performSparqlSearch(java.lang.String sourceObjectId,
                                            java.lang.String sparqlQuery,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Performs a SPARQL search on all objects in the contact list. The source object must be logged in first.
        Parameters:
        sourceOid - ID of the source object.
        query - SPARQL query.
        parameters - Any parameters (if needed).
        Returns:
        JSON with results.

      • descriptorPoolPut

        private ConnectionDescriptor descriptorPoolPut(java.lang.String objectId,
                                               ConnectionDescriptor descriptor)
        Thread-safe method for inserting an object ID (K) and a descriptor (V) into the descriptor pool. This is a synchronised equivalent for put() method of HashMap table. IMPORTANT: It is imperative to use only this method to interact with the descriptor pool when adding or modifying functionality of this class and avoid the original HashMap's put() method.
        Parameters:
        objectId - The key part of the HashMap key-value pair in the descriptor pool.
        descriptor - The value part of the HashMap key-value pair in the descriptor pool.
        Returns:
        The previous value associated with key, or null if there was no mapping for key. (A null return can also indicate that the map previously associated null with key, if the implementation supports null values.)

      • descriptorPoolGet

        private ConnectionDescriptor descriptorPoolGet(java.lang.String objectId)
        Thread-safe method for retrieving a connection descriptor (V) from the descriptor pool by object ID (K). This is a synchronised equivalent for get() method of HashMap table. IMPORTANT: It is imperative to use only this method to interact with the descriptor pool when adding or modifying functionality of this class and avoid the original HashMap's get() method.
        Parameters:
        objectId - The key part of the HashMap key-value pair in the descriptor pool.
        Returns:
        The value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key.

      • descriptorPoolRemove

        private ConnectionDescriptor descriptorPoolRemove(java.lang.String objectId)
        Thread-safe method for removing a connection descriptor (V) for the object ID (K) from the descriptor pool. This is a synchronised equivalent for remove() method of HashMap table. IMPORTANT: It is imperative to use only this method to interact with the descriptor pool when adding or modifying functionality of this class and avoid the original HashMap's remove() method.
        Parameters:
        objectId - The key part of the HashMap key-value pair in the descriptor pool.
        Returns:
        The previous value associated with key, or null if there was no mapping for key.

      • descriptorPoolClear

        private void descriptorPoolClear()
        Thread-safe method for clearing the descriptor pool. This is a synchronised equivalent for clear() method of HashMap table. IMPORTANT: It is imperative to use only this method to interact with the descriptor pool when adding or modifying functionality of this class and avoid the original HashMap's clear() method.

      • translateSessionRecoveryConf

        private void translateSessionRecoveryConf(java.lang.String recoveryConfigString)
        Translates the string value from configuration file into a valid code for the recovery policy. The recovery policy is checked quite often, therefore it is a good idea to make it numerical value.
        Parameters:
        recoveryConfigString - The string from configuration file.

      • recoverSessions

        private void recoverSessions()
        Periodically called to recover sessions according to the confgiuration file.
